intro: Nothopanax cochleatus, commonly known as the spiral leaf tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. The fruit is a berry that turns from green to red when mature, containing several seeds.
